segment.source: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager
segment.target: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager

segment.source: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager
segment.target: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager

segment.source: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager
segment.target: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager

segment.source: When Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) is installed with the Configuration Manager Integrated topology, the hardware compliance and reporting features are moved into the Configuration Manager infrastructure and out of MBAM.
segment.target: When Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) is installed with the Configuration Manager Integrated topology, the hardware compliance and reporting features are moved into the Configuration Manager infrastructure and out of MBAM.

segment.source: When you use the Configuration Manager topology, you run reports from Configuration Manager rather than from MBAM, except for the Recovery Audit Report, which you continue to access by using the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: When you use the Configuration Manager topology, you run reports from Configuration Manager rather than from MBAM, except for the Recovery Audit Report, which you continue to access by using the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: The reports for the Configuration Manager Integrated topology show BitLocker compliance for the enterprise and for individual computers and devices that MBAM manages.
segment.target: The reports for the Configuration Manager Integrated topology show BitLocker compliance for the enterprise and for individual computers and devices that MBAM manages.

segment.source: The reports provide both tabular information and charts, and enable you to filter reports to view data from different perspectives.
segment.target: The reports provide both tabular information and charts, and enable you to filter reports to view data from different perspectives.

segment.source: The information in this topic describes the MBAM reports that you run from Configuration Manager.
segment.target: The information in this topic describes the MBAM reports that you run from Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For information about MBAM reports for the Stand-alone topology, see Understanding MBAM Reports.
segment.target: For information about MBAM reports for the Stand-alone topology, see Understanding MBAM Reports.

segment.source: Accessing Reports in Configuration Manager
segment.target: Accessing Reports in Configuration Manager

segment.source: To access the Reports feature in Configuration Manager, open the Configuration Manager console.
segment.target: To access the Reports feature in Configuration Manager, open the Configuration Manager console.

segment.source: To display the list of available reports:
segment.target: To display the list of available reports:

segment.source: In Configuration Manager 2007, expand the Computer Management node, and then expand the Reporting node.
segment.target: In Configuration Manager 2007, expand the Computer Management node, and then expand the Reporting node.

segment.source: In System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, in the Monitoring workspace under Overview, expand the Reporting node and then click Reports.
segment.target: In System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, in the Monitoring workspace under Overview, expand the Reporting node and then click Reports.

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard

segment.source: The BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard provides the following graphs, which show BitLocker compliance status across the enterprise:
segment.target: The BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard provides the following graphs, which show BitLocker compliance status across the enterprise:

segment.source: Compliance Status Distribution
segment.target: Compliance Status Distribution

segment.source: Non Compliant Errors Distribution
segment.target: Non Compliant Errors Distribution

segment.source: Compliance Status Distribution by Drive Type
segment.target: Compliance Status Distribution by Drive Type

segment.source: Compliance Status Distribution
segment.target: Compliance Status Distribution

segment.source: This pie chart shows computer compliance statuses within the enterprise, and shows the percentage of computers, compared to the total number of computers in the selected collection, that have that compliance status.
segment.target: This pie chart shows computer compliance statuses within the enterprise, and shows the percentage of computers, compared to the total number of computers in the selected collection, that have that compliance status.

segment.source: The actual number of computers with each status is also shown.
segment.target: The actual number of computers with each status is also shown.

segment.source: The pie chart shows the following compliance statuses:
segment.target: The pie chart shows the following compliance statuses:

segment.source: Compliant
segment.target: Compliant

segment.source: Non Compliant
segment.target: Non Compliant

segment.source: User Exempt
segment.target: User Exempt

segment.source: Temporary User Exempt
segment.target: Temporary User Exempt

segment.source: Policy Not Enforced
segment.target: Policy Not Enforced

segment.source: Unknown -computers whose status was reported as an error, or devices that are part of the collection but have never reported their compliance status, for example, if they are disconnected from the organization
segment.target: Unknown -computers whose status was reported as an error, or devices that are part of the collection but have never reported their compliance status, for example, if they are disconnected from the organization

segment.source: Non Compliant Errors Distribution
segment.target: Non Compliant Errors Distribution

segment.source: This pie chart shows the categories of computers in the enterprise that are not compliant with the BitLocker drive encryption policy, and shows the number of computers in each category.
segment.target: This pie chart shows the categories of computers in the enterprise that are not compliant with the BitLocker drive encryption policy, and shows the number of computers in each category.

segment.source: Each category percentage is calculated from the total number of non-compliant computers in the collection.
segment.target: Each category percentage is calculated from the total number of non-compliant computers in the collection.

segment.source: User postponed encryption
segment.target: User postponed encryption

segment.source: Unable to find compatible TPM
segment.target: Unable to find compatible TPM

segment.source: System Partition not available or large enough
segment.target: System Partition not available or large enough

segment.source: Policy conflict
segment.target: Policy conflict

segment.source: Waiting for TPM auto provisioning
segment.target: Waiting for TPM auto provisioning

segment.source: An unknown error has occurred
segment.target: An unknown error has occurred

segment.source: No information – computers that do not have the MBAM Client installed, or that have the MBAM Client installed but not activated, for example, the service is not working
segment.target: No information – computers that do not have the MBAM Client installed, or that have the MBAM Client installed but not activated, for example, the service is not working

segment.source: Compliance Status Distribution by Drive Type
segment.target: Compliance Status Distribution by Drive Type

segment.source: This bar chart shows the current BitLocker compliance status by drive type.
segment.target: This bar chart shows the current BitLocker compliance status by drive type.

segment.source: The statuses are “Compliant” and “Non Compliant.”
segment.target: The statuses are “Compliant” and “Non Compliant.”

segment.source: Bars are shown for fixed data drives and operating system drives.
segment.target: Bars are shown for fixed data drives and operating system drives.

segment.source: Computers that do not have a fixed data drive are included and show a value only in the Operating System Drive bar.
segment.target: Computers that do not have a fixed data drive are included and show a value only in the Operating System Drive bar.

segment.source: The chart does not include users who have been granted an exemption from the BitLocker drive encryption policy or the “No Policy” category.
segment.target: The chart does not include users who have been granted an exemption from the BitLocker drive encryption policy or the “No Policy” category.

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details Report
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details Report

segment.source: This report shows information about the overall BitLocker compliance across your enterprise for the collection of computers that is targeted for BitLocker use.
segment.target: This report shows information about the overall BitLocker compliance across your enterprise for the collection of computers that is targeted for BitLocker use.

segment.target: Use this report type to show information about the overall BitLocker compliance across your enterprise and to show the compliance for individual computers that are in the collection of computers that is targeted for BitLocker use.

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary Report - Computer Details
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary Report - Computer Details

segment.source: Column Name
segment.target: Column Name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Computer Name
segment.target: Computer Name

segment.source: User-specified DNS computer name that is being managed by MBAM.
segment.target: User-specified DNS computer name that is being managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Domain Name
segment.target: Domain Name

segment.source: Fully qualified domain name, where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Fully qualified domain name, where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Compliance Status
segment.target: Compliance Status

segment.source: Overall Compliance Status of the computer managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Overall Compliance Status of the computer managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.
segment.target: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.

segment.source: Notice that the compliance status per drive (see table that follows) may indicate different compliance states.
segment.target: Notice that the compliance status per drive (see table that follows) may indicate different compliance states.

segment.source: However, this field represents that compliance state, in accordance with the policy specified.
segment.target: However, this field represents that compliance state, in accordance with the policy specified.

segment.source: Exemption
segment.target: Exemption

segment.source: Status that indicates whether the user is exempt or non-exemption from the BitLocker policy.
segment.target: Status that indicates whether the user is exempt or non-exemption from the BitLocker policy.

segment.source: Device Users
segment.target: Device Users

segment.source: User of the device.
segment.target: User of the device.

segment.source: Compliance Status Details
segment.target: Compliance Status Details

segment.source: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the policy specified.
segment.target: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the policy specified.

segment.source: Last Contact
segment.target: Last Contact

segment.source: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.
segment.target: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.

segment.source: The contact frequency is configurable (see MBAM policy settings).
segment.target: The contact frequency is configurable (see MBAM policy settings).

segment.source: BitLocker Computer Compliance Report
segment.target: BitLocker Computer Compliance Report

segment.source: Use this report type to collect information that is specific to a computer.
segment.target: Use this report type to collect information that is specific to a computer.

segment.source: The Computer Compliance Report provides detailed encryption information about each drive (Operating System and Fixed data drives) on a computer, and also an indication of the policy that is applied to each drive type on the computer.
segment.target: The Computer Compliance Report provides detailed encryption information about each drive (Operating System and Fixed data drives) on a computer, and also an indication of the policy that is applied to each drive type on the computer.

segment.source: To view the details of each drive, expand the Computer Name entry.
segment.target: To view the details of each drive, expand the Computer Name entry.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Removable Data Volume encryption status is not shown in the report.
segment.target: Removable Data Volume encryption status is not shown in the report.

segment.target: BitLocker Computer Compliance Report – Computer Details Fields

segment.target: Column Name

segment.source: Operating System
segment.target: Operating System

segment.source: Operating System type found on the MBAM managed client computer.
segment.target: Operating System type found on the MBAM managed client computer.

segment.source: Overall Compliance
segment.target: Overall Compliance

segment.source: Overall Compliance Status of the computer managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Overall Compliance Status of the computer managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.
segment.target: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.

segment.source: Notice that the compliance status per drive (see table that follows) may indicate different compliance states.
segment.target: Notice that the compliance status per drive (see table that follows) may indicate different compliance states.

segment.source: However, this field represents that compliance state, in accordance with the policy specified.
segment.target: However, this field represents that compliance state, in accordance with the policy specified.

segment.source: Operating System Compliance
segment.target: Operating System Compliance

segment.source: Compliance status of the operating system that is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Compliance status of the operating system that is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.
segment.target: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.

segment.source: Fixed Data Drive Compliance
segment.target: Fixed Data Drive Compliance

segment.source: Compliance status of the Fixed Data Drive that is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Compliance status of the Fixed Data Drive that is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.
segment.target: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.

segment.source: Last Update Date
segment.target: Last Update Date

segment.source: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.
segment.target: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.

segment.source: The contact frequency is configurable (see MBAM policy settings).
segment.target: The contact frequency is configurable (see MBAM policy settings).

segment.source: Exemption
segment.target: Exemption

segment.source: Status that indicates whether the user is exempt or non-exemption from the BitLocker policy.
segment.target: Status that indicates whether the user is exempt or non-exemption from the BitLocker policy.

segment.source: Exempted User
segment.target: Exempted User

segment.source: User who is exempt from the BitLocker policy.
segment.target: User who is exempt from the BitLocker policy.

segment.source: Exemption Date
segment.target: Exemption Date

segment.source: Date on which the exemption was granted.
segment.target: Date on which the exemption was granted.

segment.source: Compliance Status Details
segment.target: Compliance Status Details

segment.source: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the policy specified.
segment.target: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the policy specified.

segment.source: Policy Cipher Strength
segment.target: Policy Cipher Strength

segment.source: Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.
segment.target: Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.

segment.source: (for example, 128-bit with Diffuser).
segment.target: (for example, 128-bit with Diffuser).

segment.source: Policy: Operating System Drive
segment.target: Policy: Operating System Drive

segment.source: Indicates if encryption is required for the O/S and the appropriate protector type.
segment.target: Indicates if encryption is required for the O/S and the appropriate protector type.

segment.source: Policy:Fixed Data Drive
segment.target: Policy:Fixed Data Drive

segment.source: Indicates if encryption is required for the Fixed Drive.
segment.target: Indicates if encryption is required for the Fixed Drive.

segment.source: Manufacturer
segment.target: Manufacturer

segment.source: Computer manufacturer name as it appears in the computer BIOS.
segment.target: Computer manufacturer name as it appears in the computer BIOS.

segment.source: Model
segment.target: Model

segment.source: Computer manufacturer model name as it appears in the computer BIOS.
segment.target: Computer manufacturer model name as it appears in the computer BIOS.

segment.source: Device Users
segment.target: Device Users

segment.source: Known users on the computer that is being managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Known users on the computer that is being managed by MBAM.

segment.source: BitLocker Computer Compliance Report – Computer Volume Fields
segment.target: BitLocker Computer Compliance Report – Computer Volume Fields

segment.source: Column Name
segment.target: Column Name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Drive Letter
segment.target: Drive Letter

segment.source: Computer drive letter that was assigned to the particular drive by the user.
segment.target: Computer drive letter that was assigned to the particular drive by the user.

segment.source: Drive Type
segment.target: Drive Type

segment.source: Type of drive.
segment.target: Type of drive.

segment.source: Valid values are Operating System Drive and Fixed Data Drive.
segment.target: Valid values are Operating System Drive and Fixed Data Drive.

segment.source: These are physical drives rather than logical volumes.
segment.target: These are physical drives rather than logical volumes.

segment.source: Cipher Strength
segment.target: Cipher Strength

segment.source: Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.
segment.target: Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.

segment.source: Protector Types
segment.target: Protector Types

segment.source: Type of protector selected via policy used to encrypt an operating system or Fixed volume.
segment.target: Type of protector selected via policy used to encrypt an operating system or Fixed volume.

segment.source: The valid protector types on an operating system are TPM or TPM+PIN and for a Fixed Data Volume is Password.
segment.target: The valid protector types on an operating system are TPM or TPM+PIN and for a Fixed Data Volume is Password.

segment.source: Protector State
segment.target: Protector State

segment.source: Indicates that the computer being managed by MBAM has enabled the protector type specified in the policy.
segment.target: Indicates that the computer being managed by MBAM has enabled the protector type specified in the policy.

segment.source: The valid states are ON or OFF.
segment.target: The valid states are ON or OFF.

segment.source: Encryption State
segment.target: Encryption State

segment.source: Encryption state of the drive.
segment.target: Encryption state of the drive.

segment.source: Valid states are Encrypted, Not Encrypted, and Encrypting.
segment.target: Valid states are Encrypted, Not Encrypted, and Encrypting.
